title: Zero-dimensional space
text:
In <a href="mathematics">mathematics</a>, a zero-dimensional topological space (or nildimensional space) is a <a href="topological%20space">topological space</a> that has dimension zero with respect to one of several inequivalent notions of assigning a <a href="dimension">dimension</a> to a given topological space. A graphical illustration of a nildimensional space is a <a href="Point%20%28geometry%29">point</a>.

Hypersphere.
The zero-dimensional <a href="hypersphere">hypersphere</a> is a pair of points. The zero-dimensional <a href="ball%20%28mathematics%29">ball</a> is a point.
